sen.j: 大和天神山古墳（やまとてんじんやまこふん）は、奈良県天理市柳本町に所在する古墳時代前期初頭の古墳（前方後円墳）である。
sen.e: Yamato Tenjinyama Kofun is a tumulus (keyhole-shaped tumulus) constructed in the beginning of the early Kofun period located in Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 行燈山古墳の前方部の西方に、北向きの前方後円墳が本古墳である。
sen.e: This is a keyhole-shaped tumulus facing north located to the west of square-shaped front part of the Andon-yama kofun.

sen.j: 1960年に県道拡張工事で後円部の一部が削られたのを機会に緊急発掘調査が行われた。
sen.e: Taking advantage of the prefectural road expansion work which happened to cut off a part of the rounded rear part of the tumulus, an urgent excavation and research was conducted.

sen.j: 本古墳は、伊射奈岐（いざなき）神社境内古墳として調査が進められた。

sen.e: However, due to a policy that any person's name is not to be contained in the name of a tumulus, it was named Tenjinyama tumulus taking the local name of the place.

sen.e: The unique stone chamber of this tumulus has a rafter-shaped roof sloping to both sides without any ceiling stone.

sen.e: Inside the stone chamber, there was a large wooden container to be looking like a wooden coffin at a glance but better to be regarded as a Mokuhitsu (wooden chest) by a detailed study and about four kilograms of Shu (vermillion) was stored in it.
